info.game_comments:
2004 Power Players Week game 2.
From Washington, D.C.

(1, 1).clue: Venus & Serena grew up in this huge city's suburb of Compton, better known for rappers than groundstrokers

(2, 1).clue: After Thomas Jefferson's death, daughter Martha sold this home to a local druggist for $4,500 in cash

(3, 1).clue: 1896's Plessy v. Ferguson promoted the doctrine of "Separate but" this

(4, 1).clue: This capital's Kaiser Wilhelm Memorial Church consists of new structures & a tower ruined in World War II

(5, 1).clue: Ruth Cowan was fired by U.P. for posing as a newspaperman but joined this rival agency & reported on WWII

(6, 1).clue: Marc Brown's son requested a story about an unusual animal, so "Arthur" became this mammal

(1, 2).clue: In 2001 the Williams sisters got "animated" on the court in the "Tennis the Menace" episode of this Fox series

(2, 2).clue: Abigail, known as "Little Abby", was the oldest child of this U.S. president

(4, 2).clue: In 1989 hundreds of pro-democracy demonstrators were killed by the military at Tiananmen Square in this capital

(5, 2).clue: Seen here, Sean Flynn, son of screen legend Errol, disappeared in April of 1970 during this war

(6, 2).clue: The professor who created this holiday added an extra "A" as the end to distinguish it from an African festival

(1, 3).clue: In 2001 Serena was seen with LaVar Arrington, LB for this NFL team certain to draw cheers when you answer

(4, 3).clue: Most of the ancient portion of this city lies on the east bank of the Tiber River

(5, 3).clue: One of the greatest war photojournalists, Robert Capa's "GI Landing on Omaha Beach" was shot at this invasion

(6, 3).clue: Not Moses alone but this brother as well gets the credit for telling Pharaoh, "Let my people go"

(1, 4).clue: Venus took the 2000 & 2001 singles titles at this British Grand Slam event

(4, 4).clue: The Free University of this Belgian capital is 2 institutions: 1 for French speaking students & 1 for Flemish speakers

(5, 4).clue: Alexander Gardner started out as Mathew Brady's aide & ended up taking one of the last photos of this president

(6, 4).clue: Established in 1867, it's America's first fashion magazine

(5, 5).clue: "At Home in the World" is this Wall St. Journal reporter's book published after his death in Pakistan

(6, 5).clue: Philippine peninsula which was the site of an infamous "Death March" in WWII

(1, 1).clue: Williams was born on March 26, 1911 in this Mississippi town named for America's discoverer

(2, 1).clue: Dear Dingbat,I'm donating my chair to the Smithsonian so my meathead son-in-law won't inherit it

(3, 1).clue: Most moles destroy gardens & lawns searching for insect larvae or these "global" worms

(4, 1).clue: Married to a muscleman, she isn't an Army brat, but she is a Sargent's daughter

(5, 1).clue: Prime Ministers Tanaka & Takeshita both resigned as the result of scandals in this country

(6, 1).clue: Physician James Salisbury once promoted this ground beef dish as a cure for hardening of the arteries

(1, 2).clue: Richard Burton & Ava Gardner starred in the '64 film adaptation of Tennessee's "Night of" this arboreal lizard

(2, 2).clue: Dear Mary, Today I found out you can't do this to "All of the people all [of] the time"-Abe

(4, 2).clue: This diva seen here was renowned for her romance with Aristotle Onassis

(5, 2).clue: A 1974 scandal led to the end of Willy Brandt's career as the popular chancellor of this country

(6, 2).clue: This German watchdog was bred by the man for whom it's named; the dog has 1 "N", the man 2 "N"s

(1, 3).clue: Going to Provincetown to read for Williams helped get Marlon Brando the role of this character

(2, 3).clue: Hey Souter,Quit calling me "The Baby" just because I'm the youngest on the bench

(4, 3).clue: Carol Lawrence was the original Maria in this Broadway musical

(5, 3).clue: Politician John Profumo's 1963 affair with young Christine Keeler discredited the Conservative govt. in this country

(1, 4).clue: This 1955 play featuring Maggie, Brick & Big Daddy won the Pulitzer Prize
(1, 4).correct response: Cat on a Hot Tin Roof

(4, 4).clue: She's seen here on the right with Mary Martin, who played her on stage in "The Sound of Music"

(5, 4).clue: In the 1870s, prime minister John A. Macdonald of this North American country took bribes in the "Pacific Scandal"

(1, 5).clue: Laura Wingfield lives in a fantasy world populated by her collection of fragile animals in this 1945 play

(4, 5).clue: I predict you will name this Russian-born actress who played a gypsy fortune teller in "The Wolf Man"

(5, 5).clue: Former French prime minister Alain Juppe was found guilty of corruption for the misuse of this city's funds

(0, 0).clue: Element No. 79, it's estimated that all of it ever mined would only make a cube about 50 feet across
